entry.para: The procedure, started by the owner of the device, to allow connection to the cameras from a new Operational Cloud Service. Device transferring does not automatically that access from the previous cloud service is inhibited.
The cloud VMS, usually provided by a different vendor, that the user wants to use in his day-to-day operations with the surveillance system.

The initial cloud platform, provided by the device vendor, where the user can take ownership of the devices, perform basic configuration actions and firmware upgrade, and allow transferring the devices to an Operational Cloud Service.
The connection establish by the local service to the remote client.

chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: On-boarding devices in cloud native Video Management Systems involves two major steps:

listitem.para: A camera taken out of the box connects with its pre-programmed parameters to a Provisioning Cloud Service (PCS), a VMS provided by the device vendor, so that the user can take ownership of the camera.
After claiming a camera, the user can transfer it to the Operational Cloud Service (OCS), i.e. the cloud native VMS the user expects to use for his surveillance system.

chapter.para: The scope of this cloud service covers only the second step, i.e. device transferring between different cloud services. The procedure outlined in these specifications can be used to transfer a device from a PCS to an OCS during the initial setup, but also from an old PCS to a newer one.
